inclusion.criterion: histopathologic or molecular confirmation of either IDH-mutant DA or IDH-mutant AA
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The tumor is located in the T-L spine, unresectable anaplastic astrocytoma s/p radiation.

inclusion.criterion: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status =< 1
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: International normalized ratio (INR) =< 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Partial thromboplastin time (PTT) or activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT) =< 1.5 x ULN
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Total bilirubin =< 1.5 x institutional ULN and < 3 mg/dL for patients with Gilbert's disease
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Aspartate aminotransferase (AST) (serum glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase [SGOT]) & alanine aminotransferase (ALT) (serum glutamate pyruvate transaminase [SGPT]) =< 3 x institutional ULN
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Creatinine =< 1.5 x institutional ULN or creatinine clearance >= 60 mL/minute
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients must not have received prior chemotherapy to treat the glioma.
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The tumor is located in the T-L spine, unresectable anaplastic astrocytoma s/p radiation.

exclusion.criterion: Patient must not have received prior radiation therapy to the brain. Prior radiation therapy to the head and neck is also excluded if radiation fields overlap.
exclusion.label: met
exclusion.evidence: The tumor is located in the T-L spine, unresectable anaplastic astrocytoma s/p radiation.

exclusion.criterion: Patient must have no evidence of either infratentorial or spinal involvement with tumor.
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The tumor is located in the T-L spine, unresectable anaplastic astrocytoma s/p radiation.

exclusion.criterion: Patients who are unable to swallow tablets.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient's history of hypertension and chronic pain may impact eligibility, but no clear evidence is provided. Additionally, the patient's current treatment regimen (high-dose steroids) may be a concern for eligibility.
